page.title: 06BIRDS OF PREY (part 3)
page.content: {Sparrow hawk The sparrow hawk nests fairly high of the ground in trees but has been known to nest in low bushes.The female lays 4-6 eggs which she sits on for five weeks. The nest is built several months before the eggs are laid.The male brings food to the nest which is fed to the chicks or eaten by the adults themselves. Sparrow hawks have been seen near the Garbole road. { {Peregrine Falcon The peregrine falcon lays 3-4 reddish brown eggs. Then the male sits on the eggs for 4 weeks .Then the male brings food to the nest for the female to feed to the chicks.The chicks leave the nest after 5 weeks. It is getting rare in Scotland.There is a peregrine nesting on Brin rock. They are affected by crop spraying like eagles.
